pj_615609574286b12c: Washington Frank is a leading global provider of permanent and freelance ERP recruitment solutions across major ERP applications such as SAP Business One, Oracle EBS, Epicor, Oracle Fusion, Sage, Unit4, Infor, and IFS. We live and breathe ERP. Just ERP and nothing else. It's our sole focus, our specialism, and over the years we've built up an enviable reputation for finding the best ERP opportunities for job seekers at companies of all sizes. This dedication to the ERP field means that each and every one of our consultants has the expert knowledge needed to completely understand the market, while also building mutually beneficial relationships with customers, ERP specialists, and vendors alike. Job Title: Data Scientist Location: Stockholm  Start Date: 2019-04-08  Rate: Negotiable We are looking for a temporary Data Scientist in order for us to deliver on one of the prioritized Analytic Bets - CVM 20/20 which involves building, deploying and maintaining x-sell, upsell and churn models on CDSW. Key skills: Python, SQL, SAS, Mathematics, Statistical inference, Database Technology, Spark, SAS, GIT, Causal Modeling, A/B testing, Supervised-, Unsupervised learning, telecommunication, B2C and B2B massmarket. Key experiences: working with devolopment of predictive models for a CVM/CRM unit in the B2C area for a couple of years. CV's and expressions of interest to e.julian@hotmail.co.uk  Washington is a leading global provider of permanent and freelance ERP recruitment solutions across major ERP applications such as SAP Business One, Oracle EBS, Epicor, Oracle Fusion, Sage, Unit4, Infor, and IFS. It's our sole focus, our specialism, and over the years we've built up an enviable reputation for finding the best ERP opportunities for job seekers at companies of all sizes. This dedication to the ERP means that each and every one of our consultants has the expert knowledge needed to completely understand the market, while also building mutually beneficial relationships with customers, ERP specialists, and vendors alike. Job Title: Data Scientist Location: Stockholm Start Date: 2019-04-08 Rate: Negotiable We are looking for a temporary Data Scientist in order for us to deliver on one of the prioritized Analytic Bets - CVM 20/20 which involves building, deploying and maintaining x-sell, upsell and churn models on CDSW. Key skills: Python, SQL, SAS, Mathematics, Statistical inference, Database Technology, Spark, SAS, GIT, Causal Modeling, A/B testing, Supervised-, Unsupervised learning, telecommunication, B2C and B2B massmarket. Key experiences: working with devolopment of predictive models for a CVM/CRM unit in the B2C area for a couple of years. CV's and expressions of interest to e.julian@hotmail.co.uk
p_ab08ff93837a505e: To accelerate our business value realization from data science and to continue building Machine Learning/Deep Learning and Artificial Intelligence capabilities in Swedbank, we are looking for experienced data scientists with an edge in DevOps and SW development. About the job As member of the Analytics & AI team you in Swedbank, you will be part of a highly-prioritized, fast growing focus area within Swedbank Group tasked with driving sales, service and customer satisfaction as well as automation and operational efficiency through the usage of data, analytics and AI. As a Senior Data Scientist you have a central role in driving, executing and operationalizing analytical engagements, by leveraging machine learning and deep learning. Our portfolio of analytical services includes areas such as churn predictions, upsell/cross modelling, anomaly and fraud detection and time series predictions. You will also work closely with data engineers to support deployment of machine learning/deep learning models in data lake environment by applying latest DevOps technologies and best practices from agile SW development.  What you need to succeed You have a genuine interest in solving complex statistical problems, a structured approach towards data mining, a deep understanding of appropriate analytical algorithms and models and broad experience in leveraging relevant tools and methods. We expect you to have good knowledge in programming languages or high-level scripting such as Python and R as well as data operations and management in Spark. You master all aspects of descriptive, predictive and prescriptive analytics. You are part of and contribute to building strong teams in a creative environment in combination with genuine interest in solving complex business challenges and a structured approach to apply innovative analytics tools and technologies together with your team. As an individual you are a persistent problem solver with strong innovation drive and can-do attitude. You are comfortable with communicating the result of your work (both written and verbally in English) and enjoy collaborative work environment. You take pride in translating data driven insights into actions and decisions but also transform business vision and strategy to relevant analytical topics for development. You are expected to be an expert in your field, and constantly keep up with trends and technologies; you seek and share analytical inspiration and best practices from both internal and external sources. You are expected to lead, assist and knowledge share with others in advanced analytics, and be able to work across the business with Group Business Intelligence and GCVM Data & Tools, with various subject matter experts and business analysts. In the coming year, we focus on continue scaling up the development and operationalization of analytical insights and models especially with regards to deep learning and real-time streaming models.  Required competences Computer science/engineering fundamentals ML/Deep Learning toolkit, supervised and unsupervised learning Statistical modelling and optimization Programming (Python, R, Scala or Java) Data base search & management (incl. big data platforms, ODBC/JDBC, SQL) DevOps process and techniques/tools (e.g. CI/CD pipelines, Dockers/Kubernetes, Jenkins, Airflow) Workload Management (incl. basic Spark Optimization & HIVE Partitioning concepts) Linux based Systems & Shell Scripting Streaming Analytics (e.g. Kafka and Flink) Data visualization and storytelling Agile development methodology  Meriting competences, skills and experience Computer perception technologies (vision, speech and text) Deep learning technologies/frameworks such as Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch Reinforcement learning Kaggler expert or master Web technologies, micro-services and API development  What you may have worked with previously You have +4 years of experience from roles such as Sr Data Scientist, DevOps Engineer or SW backend Developer. You have a master/PHD degree in mathematics/statistics, applied physics or computer science. You don’t need to have previous experience from banking however it is important to demonstrate successful track record of delivering end-to-end machine learning and deep learning engagements.  Potential next steps in your career after this job This position provides excellent opportunities to gain better understanding of underlying market and customer drivers which can be leveraged later on in other managerial roles within Analytics & AI, sales & marketing roles and/or product/service development for private and corporate customers.  Why work with me/us  We are a highly skilled, dynamic team with broad diversity who take on challenges with a great deal of energy, passion and innovation. In our team we have an open and transparent atmosphere. We believe in giving a lot of freedom paired with the corresponding level of responsibility and accountability We strive to achieve a good work/life balance and we are always open to new ideas and thoughts helping us improving as a team. From November 28, 2018 Latvian Labour law requires that job ads include information about the salary level for the position. Therefore if you will be employed in Latvia, please note that salary offered for this position starts from 2250 EUR gross i.e. before taxes. In Swedbank salary offer for the final candidate is determined based on the predefined salary ranges for the position, and depends on the level of competence and experience of the candidate. Salary is one part of the overall remuneration including variety of other benefits and many opportunities provided by Swedbank.
p_f5399b319435a0fb: Masentó are working with an industry leading client based in Stockholm who are looking to experienced Data Scientist for an initial 6-month contract. As a Data Scientist with them, your mission is to turn vast amounts of data into insights that solve some of the business' most complex problems. This would be to start from April based in Stockholm.  Must have Experience: Design and build explorative, predictive- or prescriptive models, utilizing optimization, simulation and machine learning techniques Prototype and pilot the new solutions and be a part of the aim of productifying' those valuable solutions that can have impact at global scale Strong abilities in all or several parts of the advanced analytics development process: from exploring the potential of a raw data set, to building models, to scaling and stabilizing these models etc. Familiar with agile development methodologies: working in short sprints, being flexible to handle the demands of a creative and result oriented way of working Able to handle detailed analysis, work independently and in a structured way  Tools/software: Experience with languages like Python, R on a daily basis Familiar with common machine learning toolboxes (Pandas, Scikit-learn). Practical Experience with big data and Spark  If interested and potentially coming available, then please share your updated CV and we will be in contact with more details.  Thanks Masentó
p_485edd61a7da78a1: What we do at Detectify  Detectify was born from the simple idea that the internet is broken. Our founders are some of the best ethical hackers out there. Between them, they have hacked some of the biggest tech companies in the world and now they are sharing their knowledge as part of our tech teams. The knowledge they accumulated from ethical hacking turned into an application security tool that automates hacker-attacks.  Today, in addition to our internal research, we collaborate with a global group of handpicked white-hat hackers to gather security tests. Our tool is trusted and used by some of the most widely known companies such as Spotify, Trello, and King. Based in central Stockholm, Sweden, we are currently a team of 50 employees and growing quickly.  What our data team does  The team works horizontally throughout the company by promoting a data-driven culture and identifying business needs. The main mission of the team is to provide insights and recommendations to the sales, marketing and product departments, so they can make impactful decisions. We achieve our mission by taking care of the data collection and storage, batch and stream processing, infrastructure monitoring, data analytics, as well as modelling and visualisation.  Role and Responsibility  As a Data Scientist you will have the unique opportunity to work in a team that is responsible for understanding business needs and translate them into data-driven tools and recommendations. Your stakeholders will be all the other tech, marketing and sales teams.  In this role, you will be responsible for making sure that your stakeholders can take data-driven decisions, by:   Translating business needs into quantitative terms and data requirements Identifying and formulating technical requirements to our tech teams Proactively identifying relevant questions, providing analysis and insight Designing experiments to test product features Implementing and maintaining advanced statistical models Aggregating and enhancing big data with external sources Building fault-tolerant pipelines Ensuring data quality Communicating results in a clear and effective way  Some of the languages and technologies that we use are Python, Pandas, scikit-learn, SciPy, SQL, NoSQL, Elasticsearch, AWS S3, Glue, Athena, Django, D3.js and ETL frameworks as Luigi and third-party tools like Google Analytics.  Who you are  You are a creative person who sets and achieves ambitious goals in a collaborative and challenging environment. You continuously evaluate and reflect on your own solutions and seek recommendations to improve your skills.  Your background   Education in math, statistics, physics or similar quantitative disciplines Able to write readable and maintainable code Experience with some or all the technologies mentioned above You can explain technical findings to a non-technical team A genuine interest in learning and experimenting new technologies You are a team player  So, what do you think?  If you wish to be a part of this innovative, problem-solving tech team helping other developers to build a more secure internet, send us your contact details through the application below and we’ll take it from there. This is going to be fun!
p_100a23e4a3c6566a: Vi ser att du som söker denna tjänst har ett brinnande tekniskt intresse och därmed följer samt håller dig uppdaterad av utvecklingen inom ditt expertområde. För att trivas på inLightment ser vi gärna att du älskar att arbeta i grupp samt är djupt problemlösningsorienterad. Du behöver också vara oberoende och självgående då vi är ett nystartat bolag under tillväxt, initiativ och kreativ förmåga är nycklar för bådas utveckling.  Skills: Vi söker dig som är en fullfjädrad Big Data-utvecklare med erfarenhet från minst två av någon av följande tekniker - Hortonworks, Cloudera eller MapR.   Har genomfört minst tre kundnära systemutvecklingsprojekt, gärna inom finansiell handel, bank och telecom. Är social, kreativ samt gillar att jobba i team och hantera kundrelationer Vill utvecklas och känner ödmjukhet inför kundernas utmaningar Har relevant universitets-/högskoleexamen eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet Ser möjligheterna / har erfarenhet av moln (AWS/Azure) i någon mån 5 års erfarenhet av att jobba med databaser och minst en Big Data plattform. Erfarenhet av datamodellering (dimensionsmodellering minst, gärna datavault också) Goda kunskaper av att arbeta på engelska i tal och skrift. Erfarenhet av att jobba som konsult tidigare.  Du kommer arbeta såväl som Big Data konsult som utvecklare i vårt produktutvecklingsteam. Huvuddelen av din tid kommer till en början att spenderas ute hos våra kunder för att hjälpa dem fånga krav och stötta deras rapporteringsbehov. Våra kunder arbetar i flertalet Big Data plattformer.  I arbetet med vår produkt kommer du arbeta i ett team med Data Scientist, data arkitekter och full stack utvecklare, vilket innebär att du kommer i kontakt med stor variation av databaser, plattformer och språk. Du kommer fokusera på att skapa en realtidsplattform för rapportering av de stora dataflödena som systemet tar in. Du kommer också vara delaktig i att bygga det underliggande data lagret. På inLightment AB utvecklar och levererar vi kompetens för världsledande företag genom de mest engagerade teknik- och IT-konsulterna samt bedriver vår egen produktutveckling inom finansiell handel. inLightment AB är ett nystartat bolag med en tung teknikprofil. Det finns hos oss ett gediget tekniskt kunnande och när det gäller kompetens inom den nya tekniken ligger vi i absolut framkant, inte minst inom beslutsstöd och datalager.  Du kommer främst arbeta ute hos kund.
p_4087d472a120fc1e: A career in Information Technology, within Internal Firm Services, will provide you with the opportunity to support our core business functions. As a Data Scientist on a Senior Associate level within PwC, you’ll be a part of the AI & Automation team. Our AI & Automation team helps clearly articulate and optimize on technology requirements for business demands focusing on automation and innovation solutions.  AI & Automation is an autonomous team with focus on transforming and digitizing PwC internally. Our aim is to become more efficient and create space for innovation and development through standardization and automation. We work closely with the business using techniques such as RPA, Chatbots, OCR, Computer Vision and other cognitive services. We are building a strong foundation to grow and scale and are having a blast as a team doing it! As our next step in doing so, we are now launching the Business Digital Alliance where we will mix business & digital competencies to reimagine and create the future of PwC! Responsibilities In this role you will: work as part of a team of problem solvers with extensive experience, helping our internal clients solve their complex business issues and create value. work with prototyping and RAD (Rapid Application Development). develop models and analyze large quantities of data to find patterns and insights. partner with our agile development team and share knowledge and insights, both national and global. work closely with other cross-functional teams including roles as architects, business analysts and developers. ability to understand business problems, see potential, recommend actions and develop a solution that can be used. Preferred skills Master of Science in Computer Science, Engineering Physics, Computer Engineering or similar. Or extensive practical experience. Experience with a Cloud platform, preferably Azure and/or GCP. Experience with Python (or Matlab/R), ML/AI, Java/C/C++/C#. Familiarity with Tensorflow and Computer Vision or Chatbots. RAD as part of a development team, with experience from a multitude of formats (such as json, csv, databases) as well as networks and protocols. Strong verbal and written communication skills. We value proactive thinkers and doers so if you have done some Kaggle challenges or would like to demonstrate an open source project, it's highly appreciated.  Additional application instructions Submit a complete application with:  Resumé Cover letter  Your Cover Letter should be written in Swedish. Please observe that all documents are to be attached where the system asks you to add your resumé. Start date based on agreement. If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Thomas Bauer, thomas.bauer@pwc.com. f you have questions about your application, please contact Gisela Dahllöf at HR, gisela.dahlloef@pwc.com.  We use psychological tests as part of our recruitment process to make the selection process more accurate and fair for all candidates. Education (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified) Degrees/Field of Study required: Master of Science Degrees/Field of Study preferred: Certifications (if blank, certifications not specified) Desired Languages (If blank, desired languages not specified) English, Swedish Travel Requirements 0% Available for Work Visa Sponsorship? No Government Clearance Required? No Job Posting End Date May 6, 2019 Across our large and diverse global workforce, our aim is to provide all our people with specific opportunities that fit their individual strengths, interests and careers goals. Getting all of this right in a way that includes everyone is crucial for enabling our people to realise their potential - and thereby enabling us to realize our full potential both for clients and as an organization.  Opportunities are at the heart of PwC careers. Opportunities to grow as an individual, to work flexibly, to build lasting relationships and make an impact in a place where people, quality and value mean everything. The skills, insights and connection you develop at PwC are career defining wherever your career may take you.  Your career is just that; yours. You choose it. You live it. You make it happen. To get the best from it, you need the best opportunities. That's why opportunities are at the heart of a career with us. So, take the opportunity of a lifetime and join us. We'll help you reach your full potential. Location:Stockholm Line of Service:Internal Firm Services Industry:Not Applicable Business unit:IFS - Information Technology (IT)
p_d0caf15a238f8701: Just nu söker vi på Ipsos efter en ambitiös analytiker/data scientist/data developer till vårt data och analysteam. Ipsos är ett världsledande undersöknings- och marknadsanalysföretag med 16 600 anställda i 89 länder vilket gör oss till ett av världens största och mest kända researchbolag. Ipsos i Sverige består av över 150 medarbetare fördelade på kontor i Stockholm, Härnösand och Lund. Är du intresserad av att arbeta med dataflöde, visualisering och analys av data? Vi söker nu efter en medarbetare som vill börja arbeta på vår avdelning för data och analys. I arbetet kommer du att arbeta med att bearbeta, visualisera och analysera (primärt) surveydata från olika undersökningar.  Ipsos vill bredda sin kompetens och sitt erbjudande främst gällande R och Shiny, för att både bearbeta, analysera och visualisera data. En del av rollen kommer att handla om att från dag ett arbeta i existerande kundprojekt med bearbetning och visualisering i R/Shiny. Rollen innefattar även en utvecklingsroll inom Shiny, för att utveckla och skala upp Ipsos framtida lösningar i dessa verktyg.  Erfarenhet/kunskap i R eller Shiny är den viktigaste förkunskapen för jobbet. Även om andra statistiska mjukvaror också är meriterande. Kunskaper i Javascript är en bonus.  På Ipsos kommer du att arbeta med undersökningar främst riktade mot olika marknadsaktörer, men vi gör även samhällsorienterade undersökningar. Vi arbetar brett över många områden och därför att det är viktigt att du är nyfiken och orädd inför att lära dig nya saker. Du får gärna ha några års arbetslivserfarenhet, men det är inget krav. Det viktigaste är kompetens i de programvaror som eftersöks.  Tjänsten är på heltid med placering i Stockholm. Ipsos tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning.  Din bakgrund och profil:  Strukturerad och analytisk Utåtriktad och med god social kompetens Mycket goda programkunskaper i R/Shiny Andra statistiska mjukvaror som SPSS eller SAS är meriterande Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift är krav Lagspelare som är beredd att ingå i ett team Kraft och vilja att driva projekt självständigt, ta ansvar och egna initiativ Akademisk utbildning inom statistik eller datavetenskap är meriterande, men inte avgörande Arbetslivserfarenhet är meriterande,  Ipsos erbjuder: En flexibel arbetsplats med karriärmöjligheter, det är din egen ambition som sätter gränser för hur långt du vill gå. Med kontor i över 80 länder finns ett stort globalt utbyte och möjlighet att arbeta internationellt.  Skicka ditt CV och ansökan till jobb@ipsos.com senast 23/4 2019. Skriv ”Dataanalytiker market science” i rubrikraden. Ansökningar kommer att hanteras vartefter de inkommer. Vi hanterar relevanta personuppgifter under rekryteringsprocessen, och dessa raderas efter avslutad rekrytering.  Startdatum och lön enligt överenskommelse.  Om du har frågor om tjänsten kan du kontakta hr-chef Pernilla Wrangdahl  pernilla.wrangdahl@ipsos.com  Eller Björn Benzler, dataanalytiker på Ipsos  björn.benzler@ipsos.com

p_2ef93b5995f94ffc: At Epidemic Sound we are reinventing the music industry. Our carefully curated music library, with over 30,000 tracks, is tailored for storytellers no matter what their story is. Countless customers around the world, from broadcasters, productions companies and YouTubers rely on our tracks to help them tell their stories. Epidemic Sound’s music is heard in hundreds of thousands of videos on online video platforms such as YouTube, Facebook, Twitch and Instagram. Our HQ is located in Stockholm with offices in NYC, LA, Hamburg, Amsterdam and Madrid. We are growing fast, we have lots of fun and we are transforming the music industry. The growth of our business requires us to be excellent at building and maintaining relationships with our customers to inspire action and loyalty. To achieve this, we need to make our user experience next level, through intuitive machine learning and customer analytics. We are now looking for an experienced Machine Learning Music Specialist (you’re likely currently a Data Scientist, or perhaps an advanced Insight Analyst) who’s had the opportunity to use Machine Learning in a commercial environment.  Job Description The position as a Machine Learning Music Specialist will report directly in to the CTO, in a fresh new team which functions as a de-centralised squad, delivering advanced analysis and machine learning to various departments throughout the company. You’ll work alongside Data Engineers and Developers to deploy microservices solving many different business needs. The use cases range from Customer Lifetime Value & Churn prediction – to building fantastic recommender engines to further personalize Epidemic Sound’s offering. You will be working closely with the backend data team in developing robust, scalable algorithms. You will improve the personalization of the product by: Analysing behaviours of visitors, identifying patterns and outliers which can indicate their likelihood to Churn Developing classification systems through feature extraction on music to identify type & ‘feel’ of any given content Creating recommender engines so that the music our users see first, is relevant to them based on their behaviours Contributing to the automation of previously manual tasks, by leveraging the classification systems you’ve contributed to building Consulting on appropriate implementation of algorithms in practice – and actively identifying new use cases that can help improve Epidemic Sound! What are we looking for? We’re looking for a team member with a “no task is too small” mindset – we are at the beginning of our Machine Learning journey – so we need someone who thinks building something from scratch sounds exciting. It would be music to our ears if you are/have: Deep understanding of machine learning (neural networks, deep learning, classification, regression) Experience with machine learning in production and experience with MIR, signal processing and/or music theory Experience with: tensorflow, keras, pytorch, sciki-learn, scipy, numpy, pandas or similar Experience with ML projects in customer value or music information retrieval (MIR) Some understanding of ML and knowledge of state of the art in ML for music Fluency in python programming and a passion for production ready code Experience from Google Cloud and/or AWS MSc in a Quantitative or Computer Science based subject (Machine Learning, Statistics, Applied Mathematics) Familiar with musical terms like timbre, harmony, tempo, key signature, etc. Familiar with MIR/audio analysis terms like acoustic fingerprinting, phase vocoder, short-time Fourier transform (STFT) and Mel-frequency cepstral coefficients (MFCCs) Curious about our music? Find our music on Spotify here https://open.spotify.com/user/... Application Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply by clicking the link below!
p_c0114a2592d3c3e6: Brinner du för utveckla affärer och verksamheter genom insikt och analys? Då är jobbet som analyschef på Aller media något för dig Vill du vara med och bygga upp en modern analysavdelning på ett av nordens största mediehus och vidareutveckla varumärken som Elle, Baaam och Feminina? VI ERBJUDER DIG Här erbjuds du möjligheten att driva företagets digitala resa framåt och sätta analys på kartan. Aller media är en datadriven organisation som kan erbjuda dig utrymmet att bygga något nytt från grunden. Här kommer du in i en familjär och välkomnande atmosfär där vi värdesätter samarbete framför vassa armbågar. Varje dag skapar Aller media innehåll och tjänster för att göra Sveriges kvinnors liv rikare. DET HÄR GÖR DU HOS OSS Din primära uppgift blir att öka analyskraften i alla delar av affären. För att kunna skapa 360-analyser, personaliserade erbjudanden och innehåll behövs en datalake byggas och en ny organisation formas. Därför söker vi dig som vill växa och utveckla snarare än förvalta. Du kommer bland annat: Ansvara för rekrytering och prioritera actions framåt Leda och driva arbetet mot en datalake, som i sin tur kommer ligga till grund för framtida analysarbete Skapa 360-analyser för att få en bättre förståelse och bli ännu mer relevanta för Aller medias målgrupp Vara med och sätta upp KPI:er och modeller för konvertering. DITT TEAM OCH ARBETSPLATS Aller media arbetar i tvärfunktionella team och i det kommer du ha en central roll som innebär daglig kontakt med övriga delar av organisationen. I rollen kommer du även att samarbeta med Aller medias nordiska enheter. Kontoret är beläget vid Stureplan i centrala Stockholm. Teamet består idag av data scientist, webanalytiker, kundinsiktsanalytiker och förväntas växa under din ledning MER OM DIG Vi föreställer oss att du tidigare haft en operativ roll inom analys och nu gått mot en mer strategisk riktning. Du har en förmåga att få med dig människor och kan med lätthet förmedla värdet av analysarbetet i relation till strategiska beslut. Vidare ser vi framför oss att du tilltalas av att driva den digitala resan utifrån ett holistiskt perspektiv. Du tänker brett och har förmågan att ta nya perspektiv och är inte rädd för att kliva in och ta initiativ, samtidigt som förändringen man ska genomföra kräver ödmjukhet och lyhördhet. Vi hoppas och tror att du brinner för Aller medias produkter och ser tydligt framför dig hur du kan bidra till organisationens fortsatta växande. SÅ HÄR FÅR VI KONTAKT I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!
p_f862d4927895cae6: About Peltarion: Peltarion provides an operational AI platform for producing real-world AI applications at scale and at speed. It’s user-friendly, intuitive and end to end. It is the first platform to provide fast, efficient and scalable production of commercially viable AI applications. AI is the most transformative technology of this century and we make it operational for everybody. About the role: We are looking for a data scientist or technical communicator who is passionate about helping users understand complex technologies. You will be part of the Product team and will be working closely together with developers and UX designers, as well as with our Marketing, Communication, Enablement, Sales, and AI Experts teams. AI is hard to understand, therefore, all teams need to collaborate to bring knowledge and understanding to our users. The role includes having extensive responsibility for planning, designing, developing, delivering, and maintaining high-quality content for our products, including feature descriptions, user guides, tutorials, how-tos, walkthroughs, case studies, FAQ, videos, illustrations, and more. We offer a versatile role which includes: Working closely with our product development, communication, and AI experts teamsDeveloping and delivering great content within agreed upon deadlinesTurning potentially complex concepts into easy-to-understand contentGaining knowledge of our users to make sure the content meets their needsContinuously refining how we author, publish, maintain, and deliver technical documentationBeing an advocate for how to create great documentation within the organizationWorking in an agile team environmentSupporting our customers and helping them to be successful Requirements: To succeed you will need to be a self-starter, doer, and be comfortable working both as a team member and as an innovator. We are looking for someone who:Has a deep understanding of AI in all its flavorsIs user-focused and passionate about helping users understand complex technologiesIs a great communicator and thrives on making complex things clearWorks proactively in a social way by talking to people and finding things outIs fluent in English and has experience in producing content in English for a technical audienceFinds it easy and natural to communicate with people, both in person and electronicallyHas an outstanding ability to understand complex technical topics and articulate them clearly and simplyPays attention to detail and accuracyUses their own initiative and motivation to meet deadlines, set priorities and suggest improvements and new ideasIs able to use whatever tool or channels needed to enable the user to really understandLikes working in a fast-changing and growing business Bonus points: You have worked with software documentation beforeYou have written documentation in Markdown formatYou are familiar with GitHubYou have written code in the pastYou can create content in formats other than text, e.g., video or illustrationYou have worked with localization If you love to work with cutting-edge technology, a truly strong team of colleagues and want to be part of the AI revolution, Peltarion is the place for you. Contact: Peder Ribbing, People Operations @ Peltarion peder@peltarion.com or +46704823862
p_2cede5b9547e7fca: Om tjänsten Vi söker en person till vår IT-avdelning som vill arbeta med förvaltningsledning, projektledning och kravledning/verksamhetsanalys. Arbetet erbjuder stor variation och du kommer att ansvara för ett antal affärskritiska systems hela livscykel.  På avdelningen med 17 medarbetare finns idag 8 seniora förvaltningsledare, IT-säkerhetschef, IT-samordnare, Data scientist, System-, och IT-tekniker. Du kommer att ha flera kontaktytor mot t ex leverantörer i Sverige och internationellt, verksamhet, förvaltningsgrupp, slutanvändare, drift och support. Rapportering sker till närmaste chef och olika styrgrupper. Då IT-enheten är relativt liten, söker vi en strukturerad person som även är flexibel att vid behov kunna hantera t ex workshops, kravledning, utredning, förstudier och avtal med kort varsel.  Förvaltningsledning IT – Försäljning och Marknad Som Förvaltningsledare IT ansvarar du för objektet Försäljning och Marknad. Du ansvarar därmed för Transdev Sveriges system för extern kommunikation och marknadsföring samt de kommersiella bolagens system för försäljning, statistik, kundservice, marknadsföring och trafikledning som används av Flygbussarna, Båtbussarna, Snälltåget mfl.  Det innebär att du driver, leder och ansvarar för förvaltningsgrupp, licenshantering och budget för ingående system. Du har övergripande ansvar för översyn av förvaltningsbehov avseende t ex prestanda, dokumentation och information. Du kommer att vara en ”gate-keeper” – dvs förstå hur olika initiativ påverkar framtida förvaltning och vilka system som berörs. Några standardsystem vi arbetar med är t ex Salesforce, Kundo, och Ridango.  Projektledning IT När du leder IT-projekt, arbetar du med budget, tids- och aktivitetsplan. Vår strategi är att köpa standardsystem så fokus ligger på kravhantering, upphandling, implementation och utrullning. Vi använder i huvudsak PPS men Agila processer förekommer. Projekten har olika storlek och omfattar både gamla och nya system.  Tidigare erfarenhet För att lyckas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har arbetat med förvaltning av system inom Försäljning och Marknad. Du behöver en grundläggande teknisk bakgrund och vi ser gärna att du tidigare arbetat inom mjukvaruutveckling, standardsystem, Du bör ha erfarenhet av projektledning, förvaltning och kravhantering samt arbetat med förvaltnings- och utvecklingsprocesser.  Det är viktigt med förmågan att kunna röra sig mellan helhet och detaljer, kunna se olika aspekter/effekter av förändringar samt säkerställa balans mellan t ex systemets flexibilitet och långsiktiga förvaltningsbarhet. Det är bra med erfarenhet av upphandling och avtalsförhandling. Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenheter enligt nedan: PPS PM3 ITIL Agila och vattenfallsbaserade utvecklingsprocesser Minst 5 års erfarenhet projektledning, kravhantering, förändringsledning Gärna akademisk bakgrund t ex Systemvetenskap eller IT Management Svenska flytande i tal och skrift, goda kunskaper i engelska  Personlighet Vi söker en person som är driven, strukturerad och förtroendeingivande som trivs med att kommunicera både internt och externt. En person med förmåga och intresse att förstå och sätta sig in i slutanvändarens vardag, som ser möten med medarbetare i verksamheten som en naturlig del av jobbet.  Varför Transdev? Som Projekt- & förvaltningsledare IT får du en viktig roll i en teknikintensiv bransch som fyller en viktig samhällsfunktion. Vi erbjuder utvecklande arbetsuppgifter och en miljö där du har möjlighet att påverka. Du kommer vara en del i en marknadsledande, internationell koncern där IT och digitalisering är en självklar del. Våra värderingar handling, ansvar, nytänkande och samspel styr vår vardag och du blir en viktig resurs i det arbetet.  Transdev är ett stort men familjärt företag med trevliga och hjälpsamma medarbetare som har roligt tillsammans. Vi samlas gärna för gemensam frukost och fika, vi ordnar regelbundet sociala och/eller fysiska aktiviteter. Lunchföreläsningar och föredrag är andra uppskattade inslag. Vi har flexibel arbetstid, marknadsmässiga villkor och regelbunden kompetensutveckling. Här finns också stora möjligheter att söka tjänster internationellt.  Det trivsamma huvudkontoret ligger i Bromma, endast några minuters promenad från Sundbybergs station där buss, t-bana, tvärbana och tåg passerar.  Transdev vill tillvarata de kvaliteter som en jämn könsfördelning samt etnisk och kulturell mångfald tillför verksamheten och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter.  Välkommen att utveckla framtidens persontrafik med Transdev!  Ansökan I denna rekrytering samarbetar Transdev med Bleiken AB. Hör av dig med frågor eller skicka din ansökan hit eller till carina.ronnby@bleiken.se. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Vill du veta mer är du välkommen att kontakta Carina Rönnby, 076-101 77 70.
p_a9090dcf81d2d85d: About us  Remember the days when the phone rang and you didn't know who it was? If it was the company you always dreamt working for? A call from a hospital trying to tell you someone close to you got sick? Or just that stubborn sales guy.  Our mission is to make it possible for you to know who's trying to contact you, and also tell you when not to pick up. We want to remove all uncertainty, making your communication safe and efficient by separating the important stuff from the noise and create trust, no matter if it's in the beginning of a call, in the middle of a transaction or at the end of a signature. We are building a platform which empowers our users to take control of their own digital identity and making their communication more safe and efficient.  Truecaller is one of the fastest growing tech companies in the world. We have 100 million daily active users around the world with the strongest presence in South Asia, Middle East and Africa.  We are backed by some of the most prominent investors in the world such as Sequoia Capital, Atomico, and Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers.  Your Mission  You as a Data Scientist, will take on the responsibility of collecting, organizing, analyzing and interpreting Truecaller data, drawing insightful conclusions with the aim of enhancing our products and business plan influencing where we're heading as a company.  You will collaborate closely with Product, Engineering and Commercial functions in your team in order to identify and follow up on metrics, evaluate A/B tests and user behavior and identify product insights. You will work both independently and proactively with identifying improvement opportunities as well as being involved in separate projects. You will be a key member of the Business Unit by identifying and communicating data insights making sure we're headed the right direction.  Your responsibilities would be...   Analyzing customer data and assisting product development in finding new innovative ways of presenting and making use of data, including insightful visual summaries. Quickly and accurately answering key business questions from various stakeholders (marketing, strategy, product etc) Build extraction, transformation, and loading pipelines, as well as algorithmic decision making pipelines including machine learning techniques Support our management team in identifying, measuring and following up on key metrics, such as retention rates Providing regular, accurate and comprehensive statistical reports Ensuring the quality of data and actively working on cleaning data to make sure of top-notch relevance and accuracy  Some of the things we would like to see...   1-2 years of experience in an analytical/quantitative/business intelligence role Strong knowledge of data querying languages such as SQL/Hive Demonstrated ability to take complex and ambiguous business problems, break them down into small components, and tackle them autonomously Excellent data visualization skills to concisely answer business problems Great attention to detail and analytical skills Excellent communication skills in English, both verbal and written Experience with open-source/Hadoop ecosystem a big advantage Programming knowledge in at least one language (Scala/Python/Java) an advantage  We all act according to our company values - Get Sh*t done, Be Fearless, Help Each Other and Never Give up and expect you to as well!  We offer  At Truecaller we have built a dynamic and diverse culture where we are taking ownership of what we are doing. We love to experiment with new tools and technologies to push the envelope and be able to deliver the best product to our users. We believe that failure is half way to success. At Truecaller you will find challenges and passion for what we do.  Applying  This position is located in Stockholm, Sweden. We offer a relocation package if you do not currently live in Sweden.  We only accept applications in English.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, or marital status.
p_2a5fc191c8b8cabc: Ferratum Group is an international provider of mobile banking and digital consumer and small business loans, distributed and managed by mobile devices. Founded in 2005 and headquartered in Helsinki, Finland, Ferratum has expanded rapidly to operate across Europe, Africa, South and North America and the Asia-Pacific region. As a pioneer in digital and mobile financial services technology, Ferratum is at the forefront of the digital banking revolution. Ferratum Mobile Bank, launched in 2016, is an innovative mobile banking platform offering a range of banking services, including real time digital payments and transfers, within a single app which is currently available in five European markets. Ferratum Group is listed on the Prime Standard of Frankfurt Stock Exchange under symbol 'FRU'. Responsibilities Conduct undirected research and frame open-ended industry questions for different areas of the business, including but not limited to marketing, credit scoring, and collections to improve business performance in aforementioned areas. Employ sophisticated analytics programs, machine learning and statistical methods to prepare data for use in predictive and prescriptive modelling. Explore and examine data from a variety of angles to determine hidden weaknesses, trends and/or opportunities. Devise data-driven solutions to the most pressing challenges. Invent new algorithms to solve problems and build new tools to automate work. Communicate predictions and findings to management and IT departments through effective data visualizations and reports. Produce relevant documentation related to development process. Other tasks related to Data Science, assigned by manager. Requirements BSc/MSc in applied statistics, mathematics or equivalent. Fluent English, both oral and written. Good programming skills in commonly used statistical programming languages Python, R, and corresponding development environments. Machine learning tools and techniques (e.g. k-nearest neighbors, random forests, ensemble methods, etc.). Software engineering skills (e.g. distributed computing, algorithms and data structures). Data visualization (e.g. ggplot and d3.js) and reporting techniques. Previous experience of working with scoring modelling is an advantage. Curious mind and willingness for continuous learning. Why join Ferratum?  We actively strive to create the right environment and provide the right tools for our employees to enjoy their work and to thrive. Joining Ferratum you will:  feel that we believe in the development of our employees through training, education and by providing conditions which lead to increased productivity, motivation, performance and engagementjoin a fast and growing international finance companyenjoy a friendly and collaborative atmosphere with supportive teams in a fun startup-like culturebe offered a competitive salary, benefit packages and other additional perks have fun at work.
p_6107e6f167eaca03: Date: Apr 2, 2019 We welcome the opportunity to meet you! http://www.ericsson.com/careers  Why is Ericsson a good place to work: Ericsson enables communications service providers to capture the full value of connectivity. The company’s portfolio spans Networks, Digital Services, Managed Services, and Emerging Business and is designed to help our customers go digital, increase efficiency, find new revenue streams, and create new user experiences. Ericsson’s investments in innovation have delivered the benefits of telephony and mobile broadband to billions of people around the world ensuring our solutions – and our customers – are at the forefront of innovation. We support networks that connect more than 2.5 billion subscribers. With close to 100,000 employees and customers in 180 countries, we combine global scale with technology and service leadership. 40 percent of the world’s mobile traffic is carried over an Ericsson network. And, our Technology for Good and Connect to Learn programs include creating technology that makes it easier to save lives, feed societies, bring technology to emerging markets and connectivity to remote areas, and grow businesses and prosperity. At Ericsson, we give our employees the freedom to think big and navigate their career, on a global scale. We create technology that helps others, from helping people enjoy their favourite content to helping people recover from natural disasters by enabling better communications between rescue workers. Your ideas and innovations can turn into achievements that impact society and change the world, creating new connections, new possibilities, and new capabilities. Next generation technology can be staggeringly complex. But the simpler it is to use; the more people benefit from it. Join us and help build technology that makes it simple to connect with information, business, societies, and each other.  Position Summary: Global AI Accelerator Ericsson is now looking for Data Scientists to significantly expand its Global AI Accelerator team. Do you have in depth understanding of ML and AI technologies? Do you want to apply and extend those skills to solve real world, complex problems with high societal impact; going beyond ML/AI for consumption and advertising? Then, you do want to join Ericsson’s global team of Data Scientists pushing the technology frontiers to automate, simplify and add new value through large and complex data. You are a data scientist who gets inspired by large datasets, solving complex problems in a cross functional team of data scientists and subject matter experts. You like pushing the latest technology boundaries in the data science field. You have a few years’ experience of applying machine learning in practice. In this role you will be applying machine learning in the telecommunications network domain. We are constantly looking for new ways to improve and automate current and future generations of radio systems, managed services, IoT and support no solutions.  Our Exciting Opportunity: In the fifth-generation mobile networks 5G, AI technologies are an integral part of making the networks meet the new challenges and deliver performance that far exceeds networks of today. 5G networks with distributed edge compute, will drive economic and social transformation for all aspects of society. Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies will be vital for us to handle this opportunity. Already today, in order to create value from data in real time, we use several methods including reinforcement learning, deep learning, semantic reasoning and more conventional learning techniques. By using these technologies, we are able to maximize the output for each function in our highly distributed and decentralized networks making them more resilient, adaptive and optimized than has ever been possible before. Machine Learning and other AI technologies also allows us to fuel new innovation we can’t imagine today.  To even more accelerate this, we are setting up a Global AI Accelerator, to fast-track our strategy execution.  Purpose of the Job Role: As a Data Scientist, you will need to have strong programming skills and deep understanding of data science and Machine Learning tools. Have proven experience in Data Science methodologies and how to apply them to solve challenging real-world problems as part of a highly dynamic and global team. You have strong communication, collaboration and planning skills. You will be working on high impact initiatives with other specialists in Machine Intelligence to drive growth and economic profitability for Ericsson and its customers by accelerating current Ericsson offerings as well create new offerings in the areas of MI driven 4G and 5G network, distributed cloud, IoT and other emerging businesses.  Responsibilities & Tasks: Conduct functional and technical analysis within Ericsson organization and strategic customers to understand MI-driven business needs and opportunities Contribute to rapid and iterative development of high quality ML/AI applications. This includes working with petabytes of 4G/5G-networks, IoT and exogenous data, and proposing/selecting/testing predictive models, recommendation engines, anomaly detection systems, statistical model, deep learning, reinforcement learning and other machine learning systems Conduct studies and find creative usage of new and/or existing data sources. Work with Data Architects to leverage existing data models and build new ones, as needed. Collaborate with product development teams and partners in Ericsson Businesses to industrialize machine learning models and solutions as part of Ericsson offerings including providing source code, workflows and documents Work with new technologies and champion them in MI Communities within Ericsson. Assist MI Competence build-up in Ericsson Businesses and Customer Serving Units Help to develop new and apply/extend existing, concepts, methodologies, techniques for cross functional initiatives Engage with external ecosystem (academia, technology leaders, open source etc.) to develop the skills and technology portfolio for MI’s needs  Position Qualifications: CORE COMPETENCIES Strong skills in Machine Learning especially techniques such as Linear/Logistic Regression, Bagging, Bayesian model, Neural Networks, Random forest, Gradient boosting, Hyperparameter optimization techniques etc. Proven skills and track record (Github, open source etc.) in the use of current state of the art machine learning frameworks such as Keras, TensorFlow, Scikit-Learn, H2o, Spark etc. in developing ML/AI applications Experience of data wrangling and data munging, using Big Data technologies Strong analytical skills and ability to acquire new knowledge and apply it in the job Programming skills in various languages (C++, Scala, Java, R) with proficiency in Python and/or C++ Good communication skills in written and spoken English Creativity and ability to formulate problems and solve them independently Ability to develop and drive new ways of working, to produce deliverables in a more efficient way  MINIMUM QUALIFICATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS MSc, or PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or related field (e.g. applied mathematics/statistics) 1 to 3 years of real world or research experience in data science.  PREFERRED QUALIFICATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS Experience with data visualization and dashboard creation Certifying MI MOOCS, a plus Applications/Domain-knowledge in Telecommunication and/or IoT, a plus. Ability to build and nurture internal and external communities Experience in writing and presenting white papers, journal articles and technical blogs on the results Ability to work in a collaborative environment, i.e., working with complex multiple stakeholder business units, global customers, technology and other ecosystem partners in a multi-culture, global matrix organization with sensitivity and persistence  Location: Stockholm, Kista Application: Please submit your application in English as soon as possible - we are working continuously with candidate selection.  Ericsson provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, national origin, ethnic background, age, disability, political opinion, social status, veteran status, union membership or genetics. Ericsson complies with applicable country, state and all local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location across the world in which the company has facilities. In addition, Ericsson supports the UN Guiding Principles for Business and Human Rights and the United Nations Global Compact. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and development. Ericsson expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, national origin, ethnic background, age, disability, political opinion, social status, veteran status, union membership or genetic information.  Primary country and city: Sweden (SE) || || Stockholm || IT Req ID: 269139
p_1d710c86f4547213: Date: Apr 1, 2019 We welcome the opportunity to meet you! http://www.ericsson.com/careers  Why is Ericsson a good place to work: Ericsson enables communications service providers to capture the full value of connectivity. The company’s portfolio spans Networks, Digital Services, Managed Services, and Emerging Business and is designed to help our customers go digital, increase efficiency, find new revenue streams, and create new user experiences. Ericsson’s investments in innovation have delivered the benefits of telephony and mobile broadband to billions of people around the world ensuring our solutions – and our customers – are at the forefront of innovation. We support networks that connect more than 2.5 billion subscribers. With close to 100,000 employees and customers in 180 countries, we combine global scale with technology and service leadership. 40 percent of the world’s mobile traffic is carried over an Ericsson network. And, our Technology for Good and Connect to Learn programs include creating technology that makes it easier to save lives, feed societies, bring technology to emerging markets and connectivity to remote areas, and grow businesses and prosperity.  At Ericsson, we give our employees the freedom to think big and navigate their career, on a global scale. We create technology that helps others, from helping people enjoy their favorite content to helping people recover from natural disasters by enabling better communications between rescue workers. Your ideas and innovations can turn into achievements that impact society and change the world, creating new connections, new possibilities, and new capabilities. Next generation technology can be staggeringly complex. But the simpler it is to use; the more people benefit from it. Join us and help build technology that makes it simple to connect with information, business, societies, and each other.  Position Summary: Senior Data Engineer at Global AI Accelerator Unit  Would you like to change the way the world is connected? 5G is going to be a game changer in the world of connectivity. Do you want to be an influencer in making product and design decisions to run, optimize and manage 5G Networks? If yes, we have a place for you.  It will be practically impossible for human brains to understand how to run and optimize a 5G network, Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies- will be vital for us to handle that complexity. We are setting up a Global AI Accelerator in the US, Sweden and India, with 300 experts, to fast-track our strategy execution towards the adoption of Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies with in the portfolio of Ericsson Products (https://www.ericsson.com/en/portfolio) in the areas of 5G Networks, Managed Services, Digital Services, IoT and Emerging Business. You will work closely with Domain experts, Product Managers, Data Scientists and Researchers to solve some of the mostly challenging problems in the areas in the telecom domain. You will have opportunity to work in the technology that will touch the lives of billons of people and connected things as well.  Machine Intelligence at Ericsson Machine Intelligence (MI), the combination of Machine Learning and other Artificial Intelligence technologies is what Ericsson uses to drive thought leadership to automate and transform Ericsson offerings and operations. MI is a key competence to enable new and emerging business. This includes development of models, frameworks and infrastructure that we use to power our 5G networks and services. We engage in both academic and industry collaborations to drive the digitalization of Ericsson and the Industry. Our global group develop state of the art solutions that simplify and automate processes in our products and services and create new value through data insights.  Ericsson is looking for Senior Data Engineers to join our growing team of MI experts to significantly expand its Global AI Accelerator team.  Job Description: Ericsson is looking for savvy Senior Data Engineers to join our growing team of MI experts. As a team member, you will be evolving and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as, optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. You are an expert data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and evolving them. The Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data and models devOps (dataOps) architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. You are self-directed and comfortable supporting the dataOps needs of multiple teams, systems and products. You will also be responsible for integrating them with the architecture used across the company. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s dataOps architecture to support our existing and next generation of MI-driven products and solutions initiatives.  Your Roles and Responsibilities Demostrating a good understanding of business processes and domain knowledge by working with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams Driving and Contributing to the data warehouse design and data preparation by implementing a solid, robust, extensible design that supports key business flows. Drive with the creation and maintaining of complex data pipelines Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements. Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc. Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and cloud-based ‘big data’ technologies from AWS, Azure and others. Keep data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centers and strategic customers/partners. Create tool-chains for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader. Work with data and machine learning experts to strive for greater functionality in our data and model life cycle management systems. Build sanity checks and dashboards for monitoring data quality, pipeline performances and infrastructure health. Support DataOps competence build-up in Ericsson Businesses and Customer Serving Units  What we would like to see BS, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Information Systems or another related field. >5 years’ experience using the following software/tools: Expert in NoSQL databases such as Cassandra, Solr, MongoDB, etc.. Expert in tools/software for big data processing such as Hadoop, Spark Expert in handling data streams with tools such as Flink, Spark-Streaming, Kafka or Storm Expert in Data and Model pipeline and workflow management tools such as Azkaban, Luigi. Airflow or Dataiku. Expert in Docker containers, orchestration systems (e.g. Kubernetes), continuous integration and job schedulers. Excellent with functional programming and scripting languages such as Javascript or GO Expertize on serverless architectures (e.g. Lambda, Kinesis, Glue). Expertize with microservices and REST APIs. Expert knowledge in SQL and traditional RDBMS systems Expert in object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc. (Advanced level in one language at least) Leading and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment Advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of other databases/date-sources. Leader in building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets. Expertize in performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and seek opportunities for improvement. Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets. Have built processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management. Expert knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores. Expert in Data warehouse design and dimensional modeling Familiar with agile development and lean principles. Contributor or owner of GitHub repo.  Application The position is based in Kista, Sweden. Please submit your application as soon as possible, as we are continuously recruiting.  Ericsson provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, national origin, ethnic background, age, disability, political opinion, social status, veteran status, union membership or genetics. Ericsson complies with applicable country, state and all local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location across the world in which the company has facilities. In addition, Ericsson supports the UN Guiding Principles for Business and Human Rights and the United Nations Global Compact. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and development. p_07d1f25cbdce9825: Key words Data science, data analytics, machine learning, Python, automotive   About the job: We are on a journey to save lives through digital solutions for emergency vehicles. Do you love software development and have an extra passion for data science? Are you sporty, nerdy, techy or have another great interest of yours? – Then you’ll probably be a great fit for the job!  As a software developer – data scientist you will join our team of passionate and driven software engineers. As our first developer with an edge in data science you are expected to build up this capability internally.  However, you should still enjoy general software development when needed.  You might have little or no work-experience but love software development and data science. We believe in you developing the skillset that is needed.   Who you are: As an individual you are probably:  Curious to learn Willing to take responsibility and enjoy self-leadership A team player Spending your weekends with something extra-ordinary regardless if it is spending time with your kids, cosplay or climbing Mount Everest. You have the following skills and experiences:  You have a solid knowledge of Python with Scipy, Numpy and Pandas You have experience carrying out dataset analysis (larger datasets is a plus) You have worked with practical applications of data analysis such as segmentation, or visualisation You have experience with version control using Git An interest in machine learning is a plus Experience with embedded software is a plus   What we offer: We are looking for you who want to join EVAM in changing the way emergency vehicles operate. In return we offer you an exciting environment where all types of individuals are welcome. You will have a large part in affecting the company’s future. You will be given large room for learning about new technology and develop your personal skills. By joining a quickly growing team you position yourself on the fast track of career development.   About us: At EVAM we are a team of engineers on a mission to change the way emergency vehicles operate by digitalizing the emergency vehicle market. We supply our products to a worldwide market with focus on Europe and the Middle East. Office in lovely Barnängens Herrgård at Södermalm, Stockholm.
pj_fea7c2d20b73ea6a: På Sergel kredittjänster tror vi att ekonomisk trygghet är en grundpelare till ett hälsosamt liv. Därför har vi en tydlig vision: att hjälpa människor till ett skuldfritt liv. Nu letar vi efter en Senior Data Scientist som har ett affärsintresse och vill dela vår vision.  Sergel erbjuder högkvalitativa kredithanteringstjänster till transaktionsintensiva företag med 2.5 miljoner öppna ärenden, vilket innebär att du kommer ta ett centralt ansvar för stora mängder av data. Vi strävar ständigt efter att hålla oss i framkant genom att skapa system som kombinerar ökad effektivitet samt en tydlig anpassning efter individen. Som Senior Data Scientist kommer du spela en viktig roll i arbetet med att göra individuella kreditbedömningar ännu mer träffsäkra samt ständigt förbättra det stöd vi erbjuder våra kunder. För oss är det viktigt att alla får en ärlig chans.  Om rollen Vi söker en person med stort tekniskt intresse som motiveras av att ha eget ägandeskap i arbetsuppgifter och projekt. Du trivs i en miljö där du får friheten att strukturera och självständigt driva ditt arbete framåt. Vidare har du ett intresse för att skapa dig en helhetssyn över affären. Du kommer att arbeta i gränslandet mellan matematik, statistik och det traditionella tekniska och där dra slutsatser ifrån historiska data.  Vårt värdeord är We care och det genomsyrar vårt arbete både med kunden men även med våra kollegor internt. I kärnan av centrala Stockholm kommer du arbeta tillsammans med ett litet erfaret team, samt projektleda ett drivet cross-boarder team. Vi ser därför att du gillar att dela med dig av din kunskap och har en god kommunikativförmåga.  Vi önskar se att du har erfarenhet inom SQL (t.ex. SQL Management Studio) Standardmetoder inom data science (t.ex. prediktionsanalys) De viktigaste algoritmerna såsom neurala nätverk och Support Vector Machines Ensemble tekniker som Random forest Standardmässig testning och validering av modeller Verktyg som Tensorflow Scikit/Python R Minst 5 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet Svenska & engelska i tal och skrift Meriterande erfarenhet och kunskap inom Open Source PostgreSQL Linux OS Civilingenjör med inriktning inom matematik och/eller statistisk, alternativt likvärdig kunskap anskaffad genom arbetslivserfarenhet Ansökan och mer information För mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Regina Björklund på 076-677 36 31 eller Regina.Bjorklund@Sergel.com. Tveka inte att skicka din ansökan redan idag, urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
p_a5e56ddd1c7c9498: We’re looking for curious and engaged Data Scientists to join our team. Are you passionate about hands-on applications of machine learning, enjoy solving business problems and seeing the measurable impact of your work? Do you believe in empowering small businesses around the world to succeed? Join our Data Science team in Stockholm. As a Data Scientist at iZettle you develop and ship machine learning solutions for automatic predictions and decisions, and personalized user experiences you partner with product/business owners and lead data projects end-to-end: recognizing opportunities, defining metrics and goals, implementing ML solutions, and evaluating the impact you embed within multi-functional product teams to collaborate on implementing and integrating solutions you also have a team of extraordinary Data Scientist colleagues to help figure out problems, and share best practices and learnings you will continuously learn together, through our weekly research paper study group, attending conferences and events, and collaborating with academia  We hire people. Not CVs. As a Data Scientist, you'll join a team that works across the organization using machine learning to build intelligence into our products, optimize sales and marketing processes, and improve risk management. You'll be a great addition to the iZettle team if... you have hands-on experience of implementing production machine learning systems, and also a solid understanding of ML theory you are comfortable working in cross functional teams and on products with short development cycles and quickly evolving priorities you are fluent in Python or R and are eager to learn any new languages you are pragmatic, product-focused and passionate about the end results, not just the techniques used to get there you're a great communicator and you're comfortable explaining complex results, models and methods to both technical and non-technical audiences Additionally, if you have used data pipelining tools such as Apache Spark or Apache Beam/Google DataFlow, in an AWS or GCP environment, let us know. If not, we'll be happy to help you get started.  Small minds never helped small businesses It takes originality and an open mind to start a small business. That’s why small minds have no place in ours. At iZettle, we celebrate the individuality of the people we work with, valuing the impact that diverse experiences, backgrounds, perspectives and ideas can have on our culture and the products we build. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, a place where everyone can benefit from equal access to professional development and bring their whole personality to work.  We’re iZettle. iZettle is on a mission to help small businesses succeed in a world of giants. Founded in Stockholm in 2010, we revolutionised mobile payments with the world’s first mini chip card reader and software for mobile devices. Today iZettle’s commerce platform for small businesses in Europe and Latin America provides tools to get paid, sell smarter and grow your business. We’re more than 500 employees of 45 different nationalities operating in 12 countries, and we’re looking fro talent from around the world to help us grow further.  Bring your talent to our attention. We’re a diverse team dedicated to using data to build great value for our customers and we’d love your contribution. Go on, hit apply and say hello!
